properties.name: Shatrana
properties.info: Ghaggar bed widens suddently to 6-8km here. Probably old branch of Sutlej met Ghaggar system here

properties.name: Sutlej feeder 1, Early Harappan
properties.map-notes: pg 98, 285 The Lost River, and paper on Sutlej glacial flow till -2500. Early date as per Kenoyer.

properties.name: Markand
properties.map-notes: pg 58,285 The Lost River. Markand received part of head waters of Yamuna earlier upto 2700BC

properties.name: Upper Saraswati
properties.info: Course of ancient Saraswati river, as recreated from multiple documents, but primarily the excellent book by Michel Danino: The Lost River - On the trail of the SARASVATI. The course shows the Ghagghar joining Sarsuti near Rasulpur. This combined stream joins Chautang aka Drishdavati near Hanumangarh and flows into Pakistan beyond Anupgarh. A tributary of Sutlej met this upper arm which resulted in the snow-fed year round river that was described in the Vedas.
properties.map-notes: Divided into three streams. Part 1 till Hanumangarh (this one) has strong flow till 2500BC and decreases after. Vinashana can be assumed to be the trailing end of this

properties.name: Middle Saraswati
properties.info: Course of ancient Saraswati river, as recreated from multiple documents, but primarily the excellent book by Michel Danino: The Lost River - On the trail of the SARASVATI. During the late Harappan age (post 1900BC), this arm vanished in the desert.
properties.map-notes: Divided into three streams. Mid section till Marot (this one) starting to thin out till 1900BC and decreases after

properties.name: Saraswati in Cholistan channel 1
properties.info: Paleo channels of Saraswati in Cholistan. p70-75 The Lost River and its references

properties.name: Saraswati in Cholistan channel 1 loop
properties.info: Paleo channels of Saraswati in Cholistan. p70-75 The Lost River and its references

properties.name: Saraswati in Cholistan channel 2
properties.info: Paleo channels of Saraswati in Cholistan. p70-75 The Lost River and its references

properties.name: channel1 channel2 connector
properties.info: Paleo channels of Saraswati in Cholistan. p70-75 The Lost River and its references

properties.name: Saraswati channel 3
properties.info: Minor channel of Saraswati running south of Jaisalmer

properties.name: Saraswati channel 4
properties.info: Minor channel of Saraswati running close to Aravallis, corresponding to Luni's basin. There may have been a connection between Saraswati and Luni basins via Drisdavati (Hissar-Nohar stretch). p71 The Lost River

properties.name: Saraswati channel 5
properties.info: Minor channel of Saraswati running close to Aravallis, corresponding to Luni's basin. There may have been a connection between Saraswati and Luni basins via Drisdavati (Hissar-Nohar stretch). p71 The Lost River

properties.name: Mohenjodaro
properties.map-notes: Dates based on wikipedia. May need update

properties.name: Dagshai
properties.info: Origin of Ghaggar

properties.name: Sarsuti
properties.map-notes: Rise in Sirmur hills, touches plains near AdBadri, joins Ghaggar near Rasula - halfway between Kaithal and Shatrana

properties.name: Ghaggar
properties.map-notes: Rise near Dagshai, touches plains near Pinjore, flows past north of Ambala. Receives Sarsuti near Rasula. The channel suddenly becomes 6-8km wide near Shatrana, presumably spot where Vedic-Sutlej channel met this river system.

properties.name: Ahicchatra
properties.info: Luders' List

properties.name: Drisdavati
properties.map-notes: Started at Yamunanagar and north of Kaithal, west turn near Hansi, past Hisar, Bhadra, Nohar, Rawatsar, Badopal

properties.name: Sutlej feeder 2, mature Harappan
properties.map-notes: pg 98, 287 The Lost River, and paper on Sutlej glacial flow till -2500. Mature date as per Kenoyer.

properties.name: Sutlej feeder 3, mature Harappan
properties.map-notes: pg 98, 287 The Lost River, and paper on Sutlej glacial flow till -2500. Mature date as per Kenoyer.

properties.name: Kampilya
properties.info: Tunnel dug from Ganges to the royal palace, lined with stucco and cells

properties.name: Kuru
properties.todo: extant west till Parinah, south Khandva, north Turghana. get proper dates
properties.info: Brahmavarta. Mentioned in Rgveda,MB. Origin: Manu->Ila(f)->Pururava->(2more)->Nahusa->Yayati->Puru->(9more)->Samvarna->Kuru. Samvarna lost his kingdom to Pancalas, fled to a forest on bank of Indus.

properties.name: Khandava
properties.info: South boundary of Kurukshetra

properties.name: Rajgir
properties.info: Very ancient and storied history tied to Magadha and Rajgir atleast from time of Ramayana. Jarasandha ruled at time of MB. Highly prominent during time of Buddha, Maurya dynasty. After Ajatsatru, capital shifted to Pataliputra. This city should be in history books instead of Delhi!

properties.name: Magadha
properties.todo: Need timeline and dynasty extent. -2000 based on Ramayana. End with Adityasena in early 8th century

properties.name: Pataliputra
properties.info: Built in 4th year of rein of Ajatsatru's successor Udayin Bhatta

properties.name: Anga
properties.todo: texts from bclaw references need addition. Fix timeline

properties.name: Sravasti
properties.info: Center of Buddhism for 1800 years upto 12th century AD. Key trade center in its heyday, center for trade, religion, and culture. Materially prosperous, well planned city.

properties.name: Kosala
properties.info: Kosalans claim to be of solar race and descent from Manu through Iksvaku. Ayodhya was in Kosala during Ramayana times. Constant rivalry between Kosala and Kasi till Ajatasatru merged with his Magadha empire
properties.map-notes: BC Law points out that when Rama went on exile, he pointed out the vast fertile plains of Kosala country before he reached the Ganges. Date of -2000 assuming Ramayana as endpoint. Not mentioned in Vedic literature. Asura Dhundhu, apparently a natural phenomena on west coast, was subdued by Kuvalayasva. Kosala became part of Magadha empire during Ajatsatru's reign. 490BC end date based on wiki for Ajatasatru

properties.name: Farrukhabad
properties.info: eastern border of Panchala

properties.name: Panchala
properties.info: Mentioned in Rgveda as Krivis. Monarchical upto 5th/6th cent BC. Around 4th cent BC, became a sangha. Post Asoka, Pancala was invaded by Greeks. 840-910AD became a powerful kingdom under Bhoj and his son.

properties.name: Matsya
properties.map-notes: Neighbor to Salvas. Frequently mentioned with Surasenois, Cedis, Karusa. Final merge to Magadha empire

properties.name: Pava
properties.info: place of Buddha's death
properties.reference: pg49, BCLaw-Historical geography of ancient India

properties.name: Kusinara
properties.info: Where Buddha passed away

properties.name: Malla
properties.info: Contemperorary to Lichhavis and Buddha. Subsumed into Magadha empire by Ajatasatru. Jainism was popular among Mallas

properties.name: Cedi
properties.info: Mentioned in Vedas.Vasu was progenitor of Kauravas and Pandavas

properties.name: Kosambi
properties.todo: long history prior to Buddha as per wikipedia going back to Vedic age
properties.info: Vamsa dynasty traced descent from Puru. On great trade route connecting Sravasti with Paithana. Tales of Udayana abound in Sanskrit literature

properties.name: Vamsa
properties.info-link: pg49, BCLaw-Historical geography of ancient India
properties.info: Avanti,Kosala,and Vamsa were independent till a century after Buddha's death. Later part of Mauryan empire. This state was buffer between Magadha & Avanti and Kosala & Avanti

properties.name: Mathura
properties.todo: need dates, need boundaries of Surasena
properties.info: Known from Megasthenes' time (300BC) as a place of Krsna worship

properties.name: Surasena
properties.info: Not mentioned in Vedas, but considered to have very high position in Vedic age, second only to inhabitants of Brahmavarta. Claim descent from Yadu.

properties.name: Avanti
properties.info: Not mentione3d in Vedas. Fought with Kauravas in MB war. City of Ujjain said to be well connected to Surparaka (Sopara) and Brgukaccha (Bharuch) for trade. In Buddha's time king of Mathura was called Avantiputta, showing links to royal family of Ujain. Called Avanti at till 2nd cent AD, later known as Malwa. Bhoj ruled for 40 years in about 1018AD

properties.name: Kamboja
properties.info: Supposed to have lost original Brahmanical customs and become barbarous. In 10th century they defeated Pala kings of Bengal
properties.todo: Gap between Asoka and 9th century AD for Kamboja history

properties.name: Ambasthas
properties.todo: Revert type back to tribe. get details from other bc law book

properties.name: Adrijas
properties.todo: Revert type back to tribe. get info from other bc law book

properties.name: Agroha
properties.info: coins,beads,scultures found in excavation

properties.name: Sivi
properties.todo: get details from other bclaw book

properties.name: Ayodhya
properties.info: Saketa was an important Kosala city, one of the six great cities of ancient India in the time preceding Buddha. On route to Sravasti and Kosambi.

properties.name: Audumbara
properties.todo: get details from BC Law papers

properties.name: Kahror
properties.info: Legendary battle took place here where Vikramaditya beat the Sakas in AD 78

properties.name: Lumbini
properties.info: Rummindei inscription

properties.name: Kapisa
properties.info: Wine Kapisayana,Shen horses,Mahabharata mentions slavery in the city

properties.name: Kanyakubja
properties.info: Tripartite struggle

properties.name: Kasi
properties.info: Luders' List, trade with Sravasti and Taksasila

properties.name: Martand Sun Temple
properties.info: Ancient temple in Kashmir

properties.name: Girjakh
properties.info: Alexander battle with Porus

properties.name: Sagala
properties.info: Alexander Cunningham notes surrounding country is still known as Madr-desa (p.185 Geography of Ancient India)

properties.name: Sagala
properties.info: At time of Alexander, city of Sagala was at site of this hill, as per Alexander Cunningham (p. 185 Geography of Ancient India), to west of Ravi. Nearby is railway station called Bhalike!

properties.name: Amba
properties.info: Several ancient mounds, locals mention Raja Amba established these about 2000 years back. Alexander Cunningham (P.195 Geography of Ancient India) identifies with Kanishka and his two brothers.

properties.name: Balkh
properties.info: origin of Madra tribes in Punjab

properties.name: Markoh
properties.info: Alexander

properties.name: Mulasthana
properties.info: Ancient Sun temple existed at Multan. Believed to have been built by Samba, son of Krishna. Hiuen Tsang mentions idol of pure gold with eyes of rubies.AlBiruni etc described it. Destroyed by 10th Century. Malli tribes defeated by Alexander

properties.name: Piprawa
properties.info: Buddha's relics found here. Meant for his Sakya clan, in addition to a small treasure including drilled beads, gold stars, gold flowers etc.

properties.name: Puskalavati
properties.info: Ancient city, dated remains to 1400BC. Panini supposed to have lived here. Part of various empires

properties.name: Taksasila
properties.info: Ancient center of learning, one of the capitals of Gandhara, along with Puskalavati.
